revised_title: A Detailed Account of a Terrifying Whirlwind in Corn Abbas, Dorsetshire
tldr: A powerful whirlwind struck Corn Abbas in Dorsetshire on October 30, 1739, causing significant damage to buildings and trees. The event lasted only a few minutes and affected only the town, leaving no lives lost but causing an estimated damage of 258 pounds. The cause and classification of this unique weather phenomenon remain a topic of discussion among experts.
